subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Hello
msgSnippet: ... I started by reading the authoritative [manual][]; it s in Files - Resources of this group. If you want a link that you can pass around to your friends,
messageBody:
On Feb 13, 2011, at 8:50 PM, wblum45 wrote:
> So here then. I have joined because of my interest in QuickScript. But I am thoroughly confused with this "group" and "interface".
>
> I wish to learn QuickScript, beginning with Junior. Senior seems far beyond me at this point in time. Do members of this group help one another in this endeavor? How does one start?
>
> Please provide assistance in getting started
>

I started by reading the authoritative [manual][]; it's in Files -> Resources of this group. If you want a link that you can pass around to your friends, try [the Wayback machine copy][]. You'll probably want to stop temporarily around page 11 (page 13 according to my PDF reader). The manual itself includes exercise suggestions on page 9 (11); do them.

In any case, the method is probably the same all over: read a little, write a little, repeat.

When I first started out, I triple-spaced my Quickscript on wide-ruled sheets. Since my penmanship is usually atrocious, this extra breathing room was exactly what I needed to make sure I was making the letterforms correctly. Nowadays I'm down to double-spaced college-ruled paper.

A cheat sheet was invaluable to me since some of the rarer letters (13, 14, 15, 16) keep slipping my mind. I keep this [cheat sheet][] handy, especially when I'm already at another place in the Quickscript Manual.

Of course, if you think you need more educational materials, don't hesitate to make them yourself; the act of making them is a memorization technique in and of itself.

I kept getting confused by some of the more technical discussions on this mailing list, so I made a [configuratronic cheat sheet][] so I could map letters to their numbers to their pronunciations to their lexical sets. It works in Internet Explorer 9, as well as current versions of Firefox, Safari, and Chrome.

good luck!
Nathan

[manual]: http://f1.grp.yahoofs.com/v1/sHtZTbwLNtUD5vei4u8MKehnKnXiphz-S7QRnA5kdGlp6TM1Z0gOKL-w5qkkB1I4HwcUZylTmjYd-v3In6_ml_1I33usW64/Resources/QuikScriptManual%28Image%29.pdf
[the wayback machine copy]: http://web.archive.org/web/20070930224057/http://home.wanadoo.nl/uln/quickscript/quikscriptmanual.pdf
[cheat sheet]: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Quickscript_alphabet_revised_names.png
[configuratronic cheat sheet]: http://adiabatic.github.com/Configuratronic-Quikscript-Cheat-Sheet/
